Voted to condemn the lawsuit that would gut health care for millions of Americans

html: People need health care right now. We must expand and stabilize our health care system to protect people with pre-existing conditions and lower the rising cost of health care. This bill is a vital step to helping every family across our nation get health insurance.
text: People need health care right now. We must expand and stabilize our health care system to protect people with pre-existing conditions and lower the rising cost of health care. This bill is a vital step to helping every family across our nation get health insurance.

html: This is not a partisan issue. html: déjà vu noun dé·​jà vu | \ ˌdā-ˌzhä-ˈvü  , -ˈvᵫ\ Definition of déjà vu 1a: the illusion of remembering scenes and events when experienced for the first time b: a feeling that one has seen or heard something before 2: something overly or unpleasantly familiar @MerriamWebsterhttps://twitter.com/thehill/status/1104720830746030080 …
text:
déjà vu
noun
dé·​jà vu | \ ˌdā-ˌzhä-ˈvü  , -ˈvᵫ\

Definition of déjà vu

1a: the illusion of remembering scenes and events when experienced for the first time

b: a feeling that one has seen or heard something before

2: something overly or unpleasantly familiar

@MerriamWebsterhttps://twitter.com/thehill/status/1104720830746030080 …

html: MYTH about #RaisetheWage Act: -Raising the min. wage will lead to job losses FACT: In states with higher min. wage there has been very little to no job loss BECAUSE When workers have more money in their pockets, they spend it AND More spending = More jobspic.twitter.com/3103Uvb3DW
text:
MYTH about #RaisetheWage Act:

-Raising the min. wage will lead to job losses

FACT:
In states with higher min. wage there has been very little to no job loss

BECAUSE

When workers have more money in their pockets, they spend it

AND

More spending = More jobspic.twitter.com/3103Uvb3DW

html: The #PaycheckFairnessAct would: Require employers to prove that pay disparities exist for real, job-related reasons Ban retaliation against workers who discuss pay Help @USDOL enforce the #EqualPayAct Let workers join lawsuits that challenge systemic pay discrimination
text:
The #PaycheckFairnessAct would:

Require employers to prove that pay disparities exist for real, job-related reasons
Ban retaliation against workers who discuss pay
Help @USDOL enforce the #EqualPayAct
Let workers join lawsuits that challenge systemic pay discrimination

html: The pay gap doesn't just affect the women who are not making as much money as they are worth. It hurts families & our economy. Women are the sole or co-breadwinners in half of all families w/ children - providing equal pay would dramatically improve the lives of their families.
text: The pay gap doesn't just affect the women who are not making as much money as they are worth. It hurts families & our economy. Women are the sole or co-breadwinners in half of all families w/ children - providing equal pay would dramatically improve the lives of their families.

html: It’s been over 50 years since the #EqualPayAct passed - yet women still make an avg 80 cents for every dollar a man makes (& even less for women of color). The #PaycheckFairnessAct will help us close the pay gap & bring us one step closer to #EqualPay.
text:
It’s been over 50 years since the #EqualPayAct passed - yet women still make an avg 80 cents for every dollar a man makes (& even less for women of color). 

The #PaycheckFairnessAct will help us close the pay gap & bring us one step closer to #EqualPay.

html: When I started at my law firm many years ago, I fought for a #PaidLeave program because without one I knew we would lose talent. Now, in Congress I'm cosponsoring the #FAMILYAct to fight for #PaidLeave for every workplace.pic.twitter.com/sciPNmf9bI
text:
When I started at my law firm many years ago, I fought for a #PaidLeave program because without one I knew we would lose talent.

Now, in Congress I'm cosponsoring the #FAMILYAct to fight for #PaidLeave for every workplace.pic.twitter.com/sciPNmf9bI

html: I'm an original cosponsor of the #FAMILYAct because guaranteeing #paidleave means a stronger economy, healthier families and businesses, greater equity regardless of a person’s job, and more workplace equality for women.
text: I'm an original cosponsor of the #FAMILYAct because guaranteeing #paidleave means a stronger economy, healthier families and businesses, greater equity regardless of a person’s job, and more workplace equality for women.

html: Impossible choices between job & family are hurting the economy. #PaidLeave through the #FAMILYAct means moms & dads aren’t forced to leave the labor force to care for their families/health - reducing turnover for employers & making workplaces more equitable and family friendly.
text: Impossible choices between job & family are hurting the economy. #PaidLeave through the #FAMILYAct means moms &  dads aren’t forced to leave the labor force to care for their families/health - reducing turnover for employers & making workplaces more equitable and family friendly.

html: On this day we honor a man but we also affirm our belief in his vision of equality & freedom for all - and I believe that we can only truly honor Dr. King’s vision by asking hard questions of ourselves on the direction in which we want our country to go.

html: As we reflect on the state of our country, it’s clear that we have never been in greater need of Dr. King’s voice, of his moral imagination, of his willingness to brave the forces of injustice in the name of shaping a more equal and more just future.

html: If Trump shuts down the government, hundreds of thousands of federal employees will work without pay in the days before Christmas, including about: 53,000 TSA workers 42,000 Coast Guard employees 41,000 law enforcement and corrections officers 5,000 Forest Service firefighters
text:
If Trump shuts down the government, hundreds of thousands of federal employees will work without pay in the days before Christmas, including about:

53,000 TSA workers
42,000 Coast Guard employees
41,000 law enforcement and corrections officers
5,000 Forest Service firefighters
